title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
description: After changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, no children nodes are listed. When changing the data source, the new data source's children should be listed out.
OB: No children nodes are listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
EB: The children nodes should be listed out when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
SR: Steps to reproduce:  1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.  2. Open the data set editor page.  3. Go to the data source page in the data set editor.  4. Change the data source to a new one.  5. Check if the new data source's database/table/column information is listed as children nodes. Actual result: No children nodes are listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. To verify, close the data set editor and reopen it.
